turn.1: What are the main characters in The Marionettes?
turn.2: The Marionettes The Marionettes (1963) (variously translated as "The Puppets" as well) is a puppetry play by Bahram Beyzai, and one of the most important plays of the Persian language.
turn.4: It has been staged numerous times in various languages around the world.
turn.5: What did you find interesting about it?
turn.6: Together with two subsequent plays, namely "Evening in a Strange Land" (1963) and "The Story of the Hidden Moon" (1963), "The Marionettes" constitutes the playwright's puppet trilogy.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The play was composed in 1962-1963 and first published in Tehran early in 1963 by the playwright in a volume along with another play of his named "Matarsak-ha dar Shab" (i.e. "Scarecrows at Night").
turn.10: Later in the same year "The Marionettes" was again printed by the playwright; this time as the opening play of his puppet trilogy with two new puppet plays.
turn.11: Did he work on anything else?
turn.12: This volume was reprinted by Negah Publishing in the spring of 1978.
